places.title: Bodh Gaya
places.description: The most sacred site for Buddhists, with stupas and monasteries.
body: Bodh Gaya is the place where Siddhartha Gautama attained enlightenment and became the Buddha.
Pilgrims from all over the world gather at the Mahabodhi Temple to meditate and pay homage.
The atmosphere is peaceful, filled with chanting, prayer wheels, and quiet devotion.
Many visitors spend time under the Bodhi Tree reflecting on mindfulness and compassion.

images.caption: The sacred Bodhi Tree where Buddha attained enlightenment

places.title: Shwedagon Pagoda
places.description: Myanmar’s most iconic golden pagoda standing atop Singuttara Hill.
body: Shwedagon Pagoda is believed to enshrine holy relics of four Buddhas.
Its massive golden stupa dominates the Yangon skyline and shines brightest at sunset.
Pilgrims light candles, offer flowers, and walk clockwise around the platform.
The pagoda grounds are filled with shrines, statues, and chanting monks.

places.title: Bagan
places.description: Ancient city with thousands of historic temples and pagodas.
body: Bagan was once the capital of the Pagan Kingdom, home to over 10,000 temples.
Today, more than 2,000 temples remain spread across a wide plain.
Travelers explore the area by e-bike or hot air balloon during sunrise.
The temples reflect Myanmar’s rich cultural and spiritual history.

images.caption: Balloons floating over Bagan temples at sunrise
Ananda Temple, one of Bagan’s most iconic temples
